meanings.definition: Auteurism: a theory of filmmaking in which the director is considered the primary creative force behind a film.
meanings.sent1: In auteurism, the director's vision shapes every aspect of the movie.
meanings.sent2: The auteurism of the film was evident in the unique storytelling approach.
meanings.sent3: At the auteurism convention, directors dressed up as their favorite movie characters.
meanings.sent4: Her auteurism in filmmaking was like a painter creating a masterpiece on screen.
meanings.sent5: The concept of auteurism highlights the director's immense influence on the final product.

meanings.definition: Auteurism: the style or characteristics that identify a film as the work of a particular director.
meanings.sent1: The auteurism of the movie reflected the director's signature visual elements.
meanings.sent2: Fans of auteurism can easily recognize a director's unique touch in their films.
meanings.sent3: The auteurism of the film was so strong that even the props had a distinct directorial flair.
meanings.sent4: His auteurism was like a secret code hidden within the frames of the film.
meanings.sent5: The auteurism of the director made each scene feel like a glimpse into their creative mind.
